HMTL Lists

Unordered list

  • One.
  • Two.
  • Three. Note that for short items lists look better if they are compactly presented, whereas for long items, it would be better to have more vertical spacing between items.
  • Four. This is the last item in this list.

Textual elements

  • Bold look text

  • Italic text
  • Strong text

  • Subscripts and superscripts (sub and sup markup).
    Lorem ipsum dolor 1 and H2O (where subscripts occur).

    Superscripts: Mlle, 1st, and then some mathematical notations: ex, sin2 x, and some nested superscripts (exponents) too: ex2 and f(x)g(x)a+b+c (where 2 and a+b+c should appear as exponents of exponents).

  • Small text

An embedded video

Wrap an embedded video in a div with class video. J. Picard: Make it so!

Characters tests

Char. Explanation Notes
ê e with circumflex Latin 1 character, should be ok
— em dash Windows Latin 1 character, should be ok, too
Ā A with macron (line above) Latin Extended-A character, not present in all fonts
Ω capital omega A Greek letter
− minus sign Unicode minus
⌀ diameter sign relatively rare in fonts

Feedback / information boxes

Common UI usecase where feedback is given by the backend. Use a div with a class of ui-info

A p wrapped in a div with class .ui-info

A p wrapped in a div with class .ui-info .ui-info_information

A p wrapped in a div with class .ui-info .ui-info_warning

A p wrapped in a div with class .ui-info .ui-info_error

A p wrapped in a div with class .ui-info .ui-info_success
